thread.title: Hilarious video shows excited dog "loving life" as he ignores owner's instructions and goes "crazy" at Crufts
thread.title_full: Hilarious video shows excited dog "loving life" as he ignores owner's instructions and goes "crazy" at Crufts

author: Kelly-Ann Mills
title: Hilarious video shows excited dog "loving life" as he ignores owner's instructions and goes "crazy" at Crufts
text:
News Hilarious video shows excited dog "loving life" as he ignores owner's instructions and goes "crazy" at Crufts At one point he face-planted the floor after crashing through one of the barriers, went the wrong way through a tunnel and completely ignored other jumps Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Hilariously excited dog ignores instructions and goes "crazy" Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
An excited Jack Russell terrier has become one of the stars of this year's Crufts after his time in the arena stood out for all the wrong reasons. 
The hilarious footage of Olly attacking the course is joined with remarkable commentary of all the action from Channel 4. 
The former rescue pooch, rehomed by the Blue Cross shelter in Kimpton, Hertfordshire, failed to listen to his owner and enjoyed the course at his own pace. 
At one point he faceplanted the floor after crashing through one of the barriers, went the wrong way through a tunnel and completely ignored other jumps. Olly faceplants the floor after mistiming his jump (Photo: Crufts/Youtube) 
The funny commentary was also matched with slow motion replays of the dog flying through the air at various points around the ring. 
The announcer can be heard saying: "He’s all over the place and so he should be. He’s going the wrong way, but it doesn’t really matter, does it? 
"Olly’s totally crazy, as you can see he’s having a ball. Loves life and exercise. 
"That’s one of the best shots I’ve seen in a long time." Olly the dog's owner tries to keep up with him (Photo: Crufts/Youtube) 
Crusts 2017 was won by American cocker spaniel Afterglow Miami Ink. 
The two year-old, handled by owner Jason Lynn from Blackpool, was given the top award by Judge Jeff Horswell, just a day after being branded "a joke" by furious dog lovers. 
The pup's distinctive long-flowing and tricolour coat and high-set tail wowed the crowds, while Mr Lynn praised the breed for its merry temperament. Owner Jason Lynn with Crufts best in show winner Afterglow Miami Ink his American Cocker Spaniel (Photo: PA) Read More 
But some viewers were still angry that the cocker spaniel had yesterday won the Best in Group in the gundog category. Like us on Facebook
